Action.Name: StatusBar.Create
Action.Description: This action must be called in your globals. It creates the status bar object.

Arg.Name: Use Transparent Background
Arg.Description: Whether or not to make the status bar background transparent

Arg.Name: Background Color
Arg.Description: The color to which the background will be set.

Arg.Name: Use Transparent Border
Arg.Description: Whether or not to create the status bar with a transparent border.

Arg.Name: Border Color
Arg.Description: The color to which the border will be set.

Arg.Name: Text Color
Arg.Description: The color to which the text will be set.

Arg.Name: Height
Arg.Description: The height of the status bar. Set to nil to use the default height.

Arg.Name: Side Padding
Arg.Description: The distance from each side of the application window to its respective status bar side.

Arg.Name: Bottom Padding
Arg.Description: The distance that the status bar will be from the bottom of the window.

Arg.Name: Font Name
Arg.Description: The font to use for the status bar text.

Arg.Name: Font Size
Arg.Description: The size of the status bar font. Set to nil to use the default font size.

Arg.Name: Font Weight
Arg.Description: The weight of the font (how "dark" the text will appear).

Arg.Name: Italic
Arg.Description: Whether or note the status bar text will be italic.

Arg.Name: Image Icon
Arg.Description: The path to the image file which will be used as a status bar icon.

Arg.Name: Use Transparent Color
Arg.Description: Whether or not to use a transparent color in the image.

Arg.Name: Transparent Color
Arg.Description: The color in the image icon which will be transparent.

Arg.Name: Opacity
Arg.Description: The opacity of the image (0 being completely transparent and 100 being opaque).

Arg.Name: Tolerance
Arg.Description: The tolerance to use for the transparent color, between 0 and 100. 0 requires an exact match to the Transparent color. Increasing this value allows shades of the Transparent Color to be transparent as well.

Action.Name: StatusBar.GetHeight
Action.Description: Returns the height of the status bar object.

Action.Name: StatusBar.GetStatus
Action.Description: Gets the current status set by StatusBar.SetStatus

Action.Name: StatusBar.SetStatus
Action.Description: Set the text in the status bar object.

Arg.Name: Text
Arg.Description: The text to place in the status bar.

Action.Name: StatusBar.SetTitle
Action.Description: Set the title text in the status bar object.

Arg.Name: Title
Arg.Description: The text to which the status bar title will be set.

Action.Note: If you are running any plugins that modifiy Page or Dialog script, be aware that this action writes script to the "On Show" event of each page and dialog.

Arg.Note: Set to nil to use the default height.
Leave blank to use the default font.
Set to nil to use the default size.
Leave blank to use no image icon.

Boolean.True: Creates the status bar with a transparent background
Boolean.False: Creates the status bar with a solid background

Boolean.True: Creates the status bar with a transparent border
Boolean.False: Creates the status bar with a solid border

Arg.Note: Set to nil to use the default height.
Leave blank to use the default font.
Set to nil to use the default font size.
Leave blank to use no image icon.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns a number representing the height of the status bar object. If no status bar exists then nil is returned.
Returns the text of the status bar. If there is no status then a blank string is returned.

Action.Note: This function does not change the title of the status bar. Use StatusBar.SetTitle for that.

Extended.Name: StatusBar
Extended.Description:
This plugin creates a status bar for all pages and dialogs in your project. The current status is dynamic and will be displayed on all pages and dialogs without employing extra code to display it. Note: the status bar object is not a windowed object and will, therefore, be overridden by any intercepting windowed objects. View the help file for more information.
